column4: I've followed the wiki on ATI's drivers yet fglrxinfo still shows the mesa3D project - despite fglrx explicitly being listed in xorg.conf.....any ideas?
lsmod | grep fglrx
nothing
put fglrx into /etc/modules
You can do modprobe fglrx but its likely to lock the system
fglrx is now loaded, rebooted, and still not showing up in fglrxinfo
You set it up with aticonfig --inital ?
i did
dpkg-divert --list | grep fglrx
What card are you using ?
radeon 9600
msg or pastebin?
pastebin if its more than a few lines
http://pastebin.ca/84359
Are you using the ones from the repos or the new ones ?
The ones downloaded from ati.com or the ones in the repos ?
i presume they're from the repos'
i followed the current wiki
Try the ones from ati.com you can generate packages for dapper (and before I got rid of my fglrx they seemed to be working alot better than the previous ones)
supposidly the ati drivers are installed, same situation :(
fglrx doesn't appear anywhere in Xorg.0.log, yet no errors either
cat /etc/X11/xorg.conf | grep Driver
It may be a good idea to backup /etc/X11/xorg.conf (move it somewhere else) then try aticonfig --initial again
